tagDescription: Memorial of Adrian Marler for appointment as land surveyor.
Reports that 152 patents have been engrossed since the departure of Lt.-Gov. Hunter.
For 1000 copies of the Statutes of the last session of the legislature.
Wishes to appoint John Beikie as clerk to the Commission for carrying in to effect the late act for relief of heirs and devisees of original nominees to ungranted lands.
Acknowledges a letter of April 25.
Directions to have the Great Seal of the Province repaired.
Memorial seeking appointment as surveyor of lands.
Enclosing report on the petition of Jacob G. Chamberlain. (Report not at this place.)
Requesting to be informed whether John Parker is entitled to the 400 acres granted him in 1796, as a Loyalist.
Attached: Unsigned reply from Stanton. [No date.]
Forwarding a packet to Henry Van Allen.
Concerning a house for the caretaker of the light-house at Mississauga Point.

tagPerson: Selby, P., Chairman of Quarter Sessions, Western Division
tagDescription: Certifies William Hands has given a Bond for the discharge of his duties in connection with road improvements.
Concerning the forwarding of mail to Lord Camden.
Transmits the petition of John Scram. [Petition not at this place.]
Petition of Samuel Jackson for the benefit of the emigrants from Pennsylvania. Seeks to have land reserved in Uxbridge for these settlers.
Schedule of 15 deeds signed for land.
Relative to fees and early application of Capt. Miles Mcdonell.
Memorandum on the Council's decision to grant land for a Presbyterian church in Newark.
Enclosing report on 10 claims brought before the Commissioner in March. Also encloses report on the petition of Henry Young. (Reports not at this place.)
Memorandum of Messrs. Chewett and Ridout concerning salary allowances for a surveying party.
Report on the concession lines reported to be wanting in several townships in the district of Johnstown.
Encloses petition of Maria Willcocks and his report thereon. (Enclosures not at this place.)
Recommending the employment of Amos Chapman as a land surveyor upon his further study and proving his qualifications.
For 420 copies of a proclamation naming the commissioners for the purchase of hemp.
Transmits his memorial for reimbursement for travelling expenses on the circuit.
Transmitting a letter and asking for directions.
Representing that many of the concession lines in the Johnstown district are wanting.
Petition of Amos Chapman of Pelham, District of Niagara, applying for a license as land surveyor.
Giving the Lt. Governor's consent to the appointment.
Recommending Capt. Thomas Horner, Oxford Militia, as deputy Lieutenant for Oxford county, and William Dease for the clerkship of the London district.
Regarding lots in the Township of Crosby in the year 1795.
Attorney General's draft of the notice to be given to the curers, packers, and furnishers of pork intended as a supply for the King's forces. Approved by Lt. Genl. Hunter, 19 October, 1804.
Recommending Peter de Rozell for a tract of land in U. Canada.
Enclosed: Recommendation of Brock.
Transmits letters from Lord Castlereagh and Mr. Cooke. [Letters not at this place.]
Schedule of 11 deeds signed for land.
Enclosed: (1) General Return of Government stores remaining at York, 25 August 1806.
Enclosed: (3) Three blank forms for applicants for half-pay.
Same to the same. Transmits annual account for his office from 1 January to 31 December, 1805. (Account not at this place.)
Schedule of 67 deeds signed September 30.
Petition of Jas. Cutter of York for a damaged anvil from the King's store.
Applying for £200 provincial currency for mending and repairing the highways.
Transmits his report on the claims allowed by the Commissioners for June; also his report on the petition of Angus Roy McDonell. (Document not at this place.)
Enclosing duplicate of abstract of the land patents for the different districts of Upper Canada. (Document not at this place.)
On the subject of Samuel Wm. Marsh being entitled to the exemption from land fees as a U.E.
Direction to send Mr. Hambly to assist Mr. Iredell in completing the survey of the Townships of Dover and Chatham.
Transmits his report on the petition of Cornelius Ryckman. (Report not at this place.)
Regarding his half-pay as captain in the New Jersey Volunteers in 1783.
Directions to survey and lay out the rest of the Townships of Gosfield and Colchester in the Western district.
Acknowledges receiving the original deed for the Mississagua purchase.
Petition for land grants to persons named in the accompanying list.
Enclosing his report on the petition of Daniel Smith. (Report not at this place.)
Resigns his position as Sheriff of London district for the safety of himself and his family.
Recommending Wm. Jewell for land in Upper Canada.
On the subject of his application for land in Upper Canada.
Enclosing copy of a letter from E. Cooke. (Under Secretary of State) regarding a grant of land.
Regarding land granted to Mary Bowen.
Same to the same. Encloses petition of Joshua Pell with report-thereon. (Petition and report not at this place.)
Acknowledges receipt of correspondence.
W. Chewett. Copy of memorandum submitted on the alteration of the concession lines to be laid out in Township of Uxbridge.
Relative to an error in a previous letter.
Requesting leave of absence.
Requesting a warrant for his allowance as Clerk of the Assize on the Western circuit.
Referring to the 2000 acres of land he desires.
Thomas Hornor, chairman of London District Quarter Sessions. Certificate that Joseph Ryerson has given security for performance of road repair work.
Complimentary. (In French.)
Affidavit that Zenas Kinsey is the lawful heir of Benjamin Kinsey of Humberston.
Abner Boroughs. Recognizance for appearance at Court.
Encloses certificate required by the Act. for maintenance of roads. (Enclosure not at his place.)
Return from Lieut. Malcolm MacMartin, late King's Royal Regt. of New York, for half-pay.
Petition of Timothy Rogers of Whitchurch, a Quaker, for a certificate exempting him from all agency in the settling of lands in the future.
Returns thanks to His Excellency for pardoning the deserters of the 24th Regiment.
Requesting leave to bring forward the account of Thomas Smith for his survey of the townships of Colchester and Gosfield, after the usual time of audit.
Petition of Timothy Rogers and Thomas Hilburn of the Society of Friends for a list of unoccupied lots in Uxbridge.
Enclosing a license of occupation for Roderick McDonell in Kenyon township.
Regarding his half-pay as ensign in the Loyal Rangers 1783.
Recommending certain Scotch emigrants for grants of land.
Acknowledges a letter.
Enclosed: Translation in English.
Transmits his report on the petition of Jas. Macaulay. [Report not at this place.]
Regarding the location of certain lots of land in North Gwillimbury.
Transmits the petition of Sheriff Willcocks with his report thereon. [See October 19.]
Regarding lots of land applied for by John Small, at Scarsborough.
Transmits an account of the funeral procession of Lt. Genl. Hunter. [Enclosure not at this place.]
Regarding an application for land in the town of Kingston for Allan McLean.
Directing him to employ Thomas Smith to complete the survey of the Township of Mersea in the Western district.
Return of Lieut. Angus McDonald, Duke of Cumberland's Provincial Regiment of foot, for half-pay.
Informing him that despatches received will be forwarded to England. A box addressed to Lord Castlereagh contains the Laws and Journals of the 2nd Session of the 4th Parliament.
John Small, transmitting a petition of sundry inhabitants of York. [This might be the above petition dated December 5.]
Enclosing report on the petition of Thomas Smith. (Petition and report not at this place.)
For 200 copies of the proclamation dissolving the present Parliament.
Regarding repairs to the locks at his mill.
Regarding a grant of land to the Rev. Mr. Mcdonell, Roman Catholic priest.
Transmits Robt. Thorp's mandamus as one the Judges of the Court of King's Bench, and 5 letters received from the Secretary of State's Office in the present year. [Enclosures not at this place.]
Enclosed: November 19, 1805. Memorial of William Dummer Powell, 19 November, 1805.
Petition of John Crysler for land at Williamsburg.
Transmits a schedule of lands open for location in East and North Gwillimbury and in Uxbridge. [Enclosure not at this place.]
Same to the same. Informing him that Lieut. Governor Hunter countermanded his order respecting a survey in the county of Prescott.
Recommends Samuel Ridout as land surveyor.
Applying for a vessel to convey his family from Niagara to York.
Regarding his half-pay as a lieutenant in Lt.-Col. Butler's Rangers in 1784.
Authority to prepare a proclamation for publication in the York Gazette.
Memorial of Joseph Willcocks, sheriff of the Home district for the enclosure of land in the vicinity of the goal.
Regarding his half-pay as Quarter master in the late corps of Maryland Loyalists in 1783.
On behalf of Frider's claim to the land he occupies in Etobicoke. [See petition of June 12.]
tagPerson: Macdonell, A., counsel for F. Frider
Chairman of the Board of Council

tagDescription: Duke of Cumberland's Provincial Regt., commanded by Lord Charles Montague in 1783.
Regarding his half-pay as captain in the Queen's Rangers in 1783.
Requesting leave to resign his office as clerk of the peace for the London district, owing to his age.
Regarding the land for Brock.
Schedule of Acts passed in the 1st Session of 4th Provincial Parliament.
Requesting an advance of £225 for the purchase of parchment and wax to complete the land patents.
Transmitting report on the petition of Joseph Willson.
Respecting his lands.
Obstructions to the navigation of the river St. Lawrence between the province line and Kingston from sundry mill dams.
Respecting an increase of salary and land for himself.
For 100 printed copies of an Act to afford relief to heirs or devisees of the nominees of the Crown.
Acknowledging return of one set of last year's accounts. Explains fluctuations in rate of provisions.
Regarding his half-pay as 1st. Lieut. in Butler's Rangers in 1784.
Enclosing petitions of Rev. Alex. McDonell and John Wurts, with a report thereon. (Petitions and report not at this place.)
Transmits John Godfrey Plagh's petition and a report upon it. [Enclosures not at this place.]
The re-survey of the Attorney General's town lot has been completed.
Memorandum respecting the districts in which lands are or may be hereafter open for location.
Will transmit lists required.
Transmits the Sheriff's bond. [Bond not at this place.]
Schedule of 37 deeds signed for land.
Acknowledges receipt of a letter of April 28th authorizing him to continue to perform the duties of deputy clerk of the Executive Council.
transmitting a paper [Paper not at this place.]
Copy of the above letter.
Regarding land in the County of Lincoln for Alex. Milmine.
Regarding a set of abstracts of the distribution of fees to officers of the land granting department.
Alex. Grant's approval of a proposal to build a covered platform between the two brick buildings belonging to the Government.
Enclosing original bond executed by the Sheriff of the Midland District, dated 28 December 1804. (Enclosure not at this place.)
Attached: Abstract of disbursements in the Surveyor General's Dept. from 13 March to 15 June 1805.
Enclosed: Extract of a letter 3 July, 1805, on Mr. Thorp's appointment as a judge in U.C.
Requesting a reply to his letters relating to land.
Memorandum submitted to the president by Mr. Chewett respecting Samuel Jackson's land business.
Requesting an advance of £50 for his department.
Directions to furnish Benajah Mallory with a copy of the Proclamation signed that morning.
Recommending Samuel Wilmot to survey the tract purchased from the Mississagua Indians.
Same to the same. Transmitting petition of Thomas Markland and his report thereon. (Petition and report not at this place.)
Enclosed: A memorandum of Timothy Roger's interview with the President on land business.
17 January, 1803. [Enclosed in petition of Amos Ansley for survey of Pittsburgh, 20 May, 1806.]
Petitioning for a salary in recognition of his services as sheriff.

Regarding his half-pay as Chippawa. ensign in 2nd. Battalion New Jersey Volunteers in 1783.
Requisition for stationery.
Informing him of the arrival of letters from Castlereagh which he opened and now forwards. [Letters not at this place.]
Stating his services during the war with America.
Enclosed: Sept. 3, 1805 Asking for a passage across the Lake for himself and family.
Schedule of 49 deeds signed for land.
Acknowledging letters received to be forwarded by H.M. Packet Manchester.
Informing him that he will furnish the field notes for the survey of the Township of Crosby. Mr. Smith, the late surveyor removed the account books to England on his departure from Canada.
Enclosing report on the petition of Donald McIntosh (Report not at this place.)
Transmits Warrant Book No. 1. [Warrant Book not at this place.]
Requesting permission to occupy an apartment in Government House for one week to re-establish his health.
Respecting the proposed settlement of himself and his neighbors in Upper Canada.
Attesting public accounts.
Requests reply to his letter of 10 December, 1805.
Draft of a letter to be written by Lt.-Col. Green to Wm. Jarvis, asking for a list of patents for the lands of the Crown, issued from the secretary's office.
Has appointed Alex. Stewart, barrister-at-law, to carry on the prosecutions of the Crown in the western district.
Same to the same. Enclosing his report on the petitions of Wm. Fraser, Rev. Alex. Macdonell, and David Van Every.
Regarding the drawing of of lots in the Mississagua purchase.
For the printing of 100 extra copies of the Act concerning deserters.
George Magin regarding his half-pay as reduced Lieutenant in the Six Nation Indian department.
Public Notice of the Lt. Governor in Council relative to the second moiety of fees for land. [Printed.]
Informing him that the dispatches have been forwarded to Col. Green by Mr. Auldjo.

Enclosing letters from Lt.-Col. Grant, 41st Regiment, concerning deserters.
Transmitting letters from Lords Camden and Castlereagh. [Letters not at this place.]
Schedule of 67 deeds signed for land.
Regarding a grant of 500 acres of land to himself.
Giving an account of a robbery at Mr. Swayzey's house.
Informing him that deeds of land for Henry and Mary Bowen have been transmitted.
Explains delay in forwarding weekly report on land grants.
Applying for a commission as notary public.
regarding his half-pay as lieutenant in the late King's American Dragoons.
Acknowledging sundry dispatches received and arrangements for their disposal.

Relative to information received from Mathew Wing, a native of Canada, residing at Greenfield, N.Y. on a revolt which is about to take place against H.M. government in Upper and Lower Canada. Reports that cattle are being sold by Canadians, in the U.S. and the proceeds will be used to purchase arms. The conspirators are in communication with Jerome Bonaparte who will send a ship load of Irishmen with arms to Wolfe's Cove the next spring.
Regarding deeds stayed in the Secretary's office in the name of Mathias Rose.
Petition of Samuel Jackson for himself and Dr. Christopher Beswick, complaining of the a activity of Timothy Rogers.
Peter Anderson regarding his half-pay as a reduced ensign in Roger's Rangers.
Asking that his deed be sent to R. Clench, at Niagara.
For 1000 printed copies of a Proclamation of the 11th inst.
Enclosing report on petitions of Wm. Elliot, Joseph Allen and John Kirby. (Report not at this place.)
Requesting leave of absence for Mr. Chewett.
Begs to be recalled if terms on which he agreed to do the work are changed. His men have fever.
Regarding his half-pay as captain in the late York Rangers in 1805.
Recommending Capt. Miles MacDonell for sheriff of the Eastern district.
Authority for paying part of the money in aid of building churches be paid to the town wardens of Johnstown for that purpose.
Concerning Hugh McDonell's claim for salary as adjutant general of militia.
Concerning the deed for Wm. McDonell which is to be sent to the Council Office.

Enclosing duplicate of Lord Castlereagh's letter No. 3. (Letter not at this place).
For an answer to his petition for travelling expenses.
notifying him of the promotion of George B. Hall to a Lieutenancy in the Marine Department; a successor to the command of the Toronto yacht is necessary. Mentions the loss of H.M. schooner Hope.
Regarding their half-pay as soldiers disbanded in 1783
Solicitor General. Giving authority to make out deeds for lands in the Mississagua purchase.
Recommends Wm. Wells and a Mr. Thomson as settler.

Enclosing his petition for certain lots of land.

Informing him of the return of the York warrant for the Niagara church money.
Regarding his half-pay as Ensign in H.M. 102nd. Regt. of foot in 1784.
Relating to the sheriff of the Eastern district, Cornelius Munro.
Reports there was no inspection of beef or pork in the district of London.
Requesting that Adam Casselman's deed be delivered to him.
Locations made in the Surveyor General's office between 1st and 3rd June 1805.
Regarding his patent for land in U.C.
notifying him of rough plans of a survey of land between the River Etobicoke and the head of Lake Ontario.
Regarding his half-pay as ensign in 1st. battalion of the King's Royal Regt. of New York in 1783.
Assigning reasons why the weekly report was not sent in as usual.

Acknowledging letters for H.M. Packet Prince Adolphus, sailing 2 October.
Authorizing the survey of part of the township of Crosby.

Notice that Isaac Pilkington is appointed Crier of the Court of King's Bench.

Complains of having to pay eight pence on letters sent from the Department.

For the printing of 100 copies of a pamphlet on the cultivation of hemp.

Regarding errors made in a petition for land for John Richardson.

For copies of the Acts for the government printer.
Mary Popst, Elizabeth Brownell, Mary Link, are entitled to their patents free of expense as daughters of U.E. Loyalists although their names do not appear on the U.E. list.
Desires to establish a school among the Germans in Markham to teach the children English. Would act as interpreter in the militia. Requests land that he may live in Markham.
Enclosing assessment rolls. (Document not at this place.)

Lt. Hall to remain on the Camden to perfect himself in the navigation of Lake Erie.
Notice that parliament will prorogue on Monday next.

Amos Ansley complains that Patrick Langan and others are destroying and taking away the King's pine and oak on Grande Isle; Proclamation by John Small regarding persons claiming Grand Isle. (Printed.)
Acknowledges receipt of a letter on a grant of land to Barzillai Beal.
Relative to salaries for the men surveying the Townships of Orford, Dover, and Chatham.
Seeking encouragement to further explore a remarkable cave they have discovered in the second township, Mississagua purchase.
